intro: Lathyrus japonicus var. parviflorus, commonly known as the Japanese vetch, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers in shades of pink or purple, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soil and is often found in woodland or grassy areas.
